summary: The Semiconductor Technology Advancement and Research Act of 2025 (the STAR Act) amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a 25% tax credit for qualified semiconductor design expenditures, in addition to the existing advanced manufacturing investment credit. It defines qualified semiconductor design expenses and activities eligible for the credit, specifies rules for aggregation, and coordinates with other research credits. The credit is available for expenditures until December 31, 2036. The bill aims to incentivize semiconductor design and manufacturing within the U.S.
